articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Night Exercise of KPA Paratroopers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Night Exercise of KPA Paratroopers
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, guided a night exercise of air-borne units of the KPA.
					 After receiving a report on the plan of the exercise from a commanding officer, he gave an order to start the exercise.
					
					 Transport planes appeared in the sky above the drill ground, dropping paratroopers like hail.
					
					 The paratroopers showed the supreme commander their admirable actions of accurately landing on the designated points and occupying the "enemy's position" at one go by satisfactorily applying the combat ways and methods they cultivated in their day-to-day trainings.
					
					A-match-for-a hundred fighters who have undergone trainings day and night successfully carried out the order given by the supreme commander.
					
					 Noting that the exercise was very successful, he highly praised the combatants and airmen for successfully performing their difficult duties even under unfavorable night conditions.
					
					 He met the combatants who successfully conducted the drill of landing on the designated points requiring admirable pluck and high technique and encouraged them.
					
					 He gave important instructions to raise a stronger wind of training just as the anti-Japanese guerrillas did in Mt. Paektu, underscoring the need for the KPA to put spurs to rounding off the combat preparedness, the main task for bolstering up the military capabilities of the KPA.
					
					 A war against the enemy is fought in the worst conditions, he said, underlining the need for the soldiers to conduct training under the simulated conditions of a real war with high ideological awareness in order to satisfactorily perform their combat duties under any circumstances and conditions.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Pyon In Son, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Su Gil, Ri Pyong Chol, Pak Jong Chon and Hwang Pyong So.

articles.title: American Citizen Interviewed
articles.content:
American Criminal Interviewed
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- An American criminal, Kenneth Bae, was interviewed by local and foreign reporters at the Pyongyang Friendship Hospital  Monday at his request.
					 He said he called the press conference to clarify some facts.
					
					 Over the past 15 months he, through meeting with officials of the Swedish embassy and calls and correspondence with his family, he correctly informed the U.S. government and his family of his criminal acts and humanitarian measures taken by the DPRK government in his behalf, he said, adding:
					
					 But some media are spreading misinformation about me and launching smear campaign against the DPRK, driving me into a difficult situation.
					
					 For example, the U.S. vice-president, at a press conference over the release of another U.S. citizen, Mr. Newman, in December last year, claimed that I have been detained here for no reason.
					
					 Some time ago even my sister reportedly told reporters that I am not guilty. I think such facts enraged people here.
					
					 This is why I am in a puzzle.
					
					 Over the past five months I have been hospitalized, but now I am afraid I may be sent back to the labor camp. Worse still, I am afraid the pardon for me becomes more difficult.
					
					 To cite another example, I was told that some media reports alleged that the DPRK is a "human rights violator", its human rights records are not good and that I have been treated unfairly.
					
					 What I would like to clarify here now is that there has been no human rights abuse and no unfair, severe act for me.
					
					 The DPRK government has done every possible thing for me from the humanitarian point of view. It allowed me to contact with the Swedish embassy and have correspondence and calls with my family. It also gave me an opportunity to meet my mother here and offered me a medical service at the hospital when my disease got worse. 
					
					 I, availing myself of this opportunity, call on the U.S. government, media and my family to stop link any smear campaign against the DPRK and false materials with me, making my situation worse.
					
					 I hope that I will be pardoned by the DPRK and go back to my family. I request the U.S. government, media and my family to pay deep concern and make all efforts to this end.
					
					 Bae gave answers to questions raised by reporters.

articles.title: Schoolchildren's Sports Contest Opens
articles.content:
Schoolchildren's Sports Contest Opens
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The 40th National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize opened with due ceremony at the Taekwon-Do Hall on Monday.
					 The sports contest will take place in Pyongyang City, Phyongsong City of South Phyongan Province and Sariwon City of North Hwanghae Province from January to August and bring together about 10,000 schoolchildren across the country.
					
					 The players will compete in 17 events such as basketball, volleyball, table-tennis, Taekwon-Do, Korean wrestling, divided into groups of senior secondary school, junior secondary school and primary school.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, made an opening speech.
					
					 Then followed a Taekwon-Do demonstration by schoolchildren.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, officials concerned, officials of the youth league and schoolchildren.

articles.title: International Matches to Be Played by DPRK Footballers This Year
articles.content:
International Matches to Be Played by DPRK Footballers This Year
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Footballers of the DPRK will play various international matches this year.
					 In July boys will play matches for berth for the 2015 AFC U-22 Championship.
					
					 They will also participate in AFC U-14, U-16 and U-19 championships scheduled to be held in Iran, Thailand and Myanmar in August, September and October.
					
					 Men and women football teams will play matches of the 2014 Asian Games from Sep. 19 to Oct. 4.
					
					 Women footballers will also participate in the 2014 FIFA U-17, U-20 Women World Cups which will begin in Costa Rica from mid-March and in Canada from early August.

articles.title: Army-People Concerted Efforts' Role in Socialist Construction
articles.content:
Army-People Concerted Efforts' Role in Socialist Construction
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, stressed in his New Year Address that the service personnel and people should make concerted efforts to build up Pyongyang so that it is more grandiose.
					 It is the intention of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) to raise a fierce wind of making a fresh leap forward on all fronts of building a thriving country with a might of the army-people concerted efforts.
					
					 To make army-people concerted efforts is one of powerful methods of struggle that the army and people of the DPRK wage strong offensive with the same idea and will.
					
					 In the DPRK, the Korean People's Army plays a big role in socialist construction as well as in defending the country.
					
					 The WPK has set it as the key mode of struggle for building a thriving nation to make army-people concerted efforts.
					
					 With the concerted efforts, the army and the people finished the building of the Huichon Power Station in a short span of three years and built up many edifices throughout the country.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will give fullest play to their concerted efforts this year, thus making an active contribution to ushering in a new heyday of construction.

articles.title: Production of Functional Vinyl Sheets Active in DPRK
articles.content:
Production of Functional Vinyl Sheets Active in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Three-layer functional vinyl sheets have been produced in large quantities at the high-pressure polyethylene workshop of the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex in the DPRK.
					 The sheet, 8-12 meters wide and 0.06-0.12 mm thick, is effective, particularly in greenhouse, as it performs a function of preventing ultraviolet rays, dew and dust.
					
					 For the production of the sheet, the workshop has two processes, functional additives production process and vinyl sheet production process.
					
					 The sheet production will encourage the building of greenhouses in the country.
					
					 When visiting the complex on June 19, Juche 102 (2013), supreme leader Kim Jong Un expressed satisfaction over the fact that the complex had modernly built the large-capacity sheet production processes.

articles.title: Many Art Works Created in DPRK
articles.content:
Many Art Works Created in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Men of literature and art in the DPRK have made positive efforts to produce many works of different themes which are high in ideological and artistic value in hearty response to the New Year Address of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea works hard to create poetries and a cycle of revolutionary legends, which highly praise the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and noble personality of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It also put efforts in creating fairy tales, fables, songs and poems for children, while stepping up edition of reference books for improving creative insight of writers.
					
					 The TV Drama Studio strives to produce dramas of high ideological and artistic value. 
					
					 Artistes of the Phibada Opera Troupe, the National Theatrical Troup, National Circus and other art troupes in Pyongyang find themselves among workers of major industrial establishments here, including the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex and East Pyongyang Thermal Power Plant, to encourage workers to boost production.
					
					 Field artistic activities have been conducted by the central art squad for agitation for increased production and art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					
					 And artists of the Mansudae Art Studio and the Central Fine Arts Studio, teachers of the Pyongyang University of Fine Arts and other artists in Pyongyang are taking active part in conducting information service through visual aids to inspire workers and farmers to an increased production drive.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Behave with Discretion: News Analysis
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Behave with Discretion: News Analysis
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe in a New Year interview let loose a string of reckless remarks aimed at Japan's militarization.
					 He said now is the time for Japan to begin with the work to restore "strong Japan" and discussion on the revision of the Constitution, in line with the change of the times, should be deepened among the people.
					
					 Such remarks can be made only by Abe, who is hell bent on moves for turning Japan into a military power and launching reinvasion.
					
					 From the very day of his assumption of power, he called for widely disseminating "Kimigayo", symbolic of militarism, saying it will be the "first stride to restore strong Japan". 
					
					 He has repeated his assertion to restore "strong Japan" whenever opportunity presents itself, while clamoring that Japan should get rid of "postwar regime" and revise the "Pacifist Constitution".
					
					 "Strong Japan" loudmouthed by Abe means nothing but militarist Japan which ran amuck in the moves for a war of aggression on the Asian countries in the 20th century. 
					
					 His call for revision of the "Constitution" is aimed to lay a legal foundation for reviving militarism in Japan and realizing the ambition for reinvasion.
					
					 In case the constitution is revised in favor of realizing the ambition, the Japanese reactionaries will not hesitate in taking the road of reinvasion.
					
					 The reality clearly shows that Japan still remains as an aggressor country posing a threat to peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Japan's denial of crime-woven history and the frantic militarist remarks made by descendents of war criminals evokes serious concern among not only neighboring countries but even the allies of Japan.
					
					 Japanese reactionaries including Abe should be mindful that their persistent moves for the revival of militarism will lead Japan to ruin, not "strong one".

articles.title: News Analyst on Japan's History of Aggression on Korea
articles.content:
News Analyst on Japan's History of Aggression on Korea
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Japan's past history of aggression on Korea is woven with untold and heinous crimes, which reduced the Koreans into its slaves by repressing, plundering and killing them at random with the harsh fascist rule.
					 Among the crimes was an assassination of Kojong on January 22, 1919. 
					
					 Kojong, emperor of Korea, opposed to the conclusion of the "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty", demanded by the Japanese imperialists to deprive Korea of its right to diplomacy, and refused to sign and seal the "treaty".
					
					 When the "treaty" was forcibly concluded, the emperor made every possible effort to quash it with help of major powers.
					
					 He sent to heads of state of different countries his personal letters and secret messages showing the illegality and invalidity of the "treaty". And emissaries were dispatched to the 2nd International Peace Conference held in Hague in June 1907 to proclaim its invalidity and condemn Japan's aggression on Korea.
					
					 Meanwhile, Kojong gave a secret order of waging the anti-Japanese patriotic volunteers' struggle and used his authority to control the pro-Japanese elements. He also worked as possible as he could to deter the Japanese imperialists' moves for colonial dominion, standing against the "Jongmi Seven-Point Treaty", the keynote of which was to wrest the right of home administration from Korea.
					
					 Alarmed at such movement, the Japanese imperialists forcibly dethroned Kojong and at last brutally poisoned him to death.
					
					 In this regard, a Japanese book wrote: The truth of the case came to light at last. Imperial Japan let its stooge Han Sang Hak put poison into food for Kojong. In less than one hour after taking the meal, the emperor groaned with pain, saying what kind of food made him sick, and died soon. His eyes were blood-shot, with stigmas founded on his whole body.
					
					 According to a diary of Yuzaburo Kuratomi, director of the auditing bureau at Japan's royal office at that time, the then Japanese prime minister instructed the "governor-general" in Korea to poison Kojong for the reason that he refused to acknowledge the "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty".
					
					 The assassination of Kojong was a never-to-be-condoned state terrorism against the sovereignty of Korea and the dignity of its nation.
					
					 It has been 95 years after the case, but Japan is still refusing to make apology and reparation for its past crimes while persistently denying the past history of aggression. On the contrary, it is embellishing the past to launch reinvasion.
					
					 The dangerous moves of the Japanese reactionaries to repeat their past crimes are now arousing criticism of many countries in Asia and the rest of the world, including the DPRK.
					
					 Japan should come out for the settlement of the past at an early date, clearly seeing the Korean army and people's will to force Japan to pay dearly for the blood shed by the Koreans.

articles.title: Spirit of Mt. Paektu Is Eternal Treasure of Country: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Spirit of Mt. Paektu Is Eternal Treasure of Country: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu is the fundamental source of the great mental power of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea and its eternal treasure, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu is the noble revolutionary one created in the flames of the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The spirit is the great revolutionary one which helps firmly consolidate the DPRK's single-minded unity based on the spirit of devotedly defending the leader.
					
					 The spirit of devotedly defending the leader and the tradition of single-minded unity created in the flames of the anti-Japanese armed struggle always serve as the source of the ever-victorious Korean revolution and the powerful driving force for it.
					
					 The anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters are the pioneers and forerunners of the Korean revolution who regarded the immortal Juche idea founded by the President as their precious guideline.
					
					 The revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu is the indomitable revolutionary one to win a victory at any cost.
					
					  A fighter cut off his decomposing leg for revolution and another fighter shouted that the victory of revolution was in sight although she was deprived of her two eyes by the enemy. Such indomitable fighters were the first generation of the Korean revolution.
					
					 It is thanks to the heroic struggle of the service personnel and the people who inherited the soul of Mt. Paektu and the indomitable fighting spirit that the DPRK is advancing in the spirit of making a leap forward full of vigor.

articles.title: US Criticized for Scheming to Launch Military Exercises: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US Criticized for Scheming to Launch Military Exercises: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. decided to soon deploy a mechanized infantry unit composed of 40 latest tanks and 40 armored cars near the Military Demarcation Line of Korea 
					 It also announced that it will launch Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises from late February to late April.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a commentary said that this is a dangerous war racket to ignite the 2nd Korean War at any cost by reinforcing aggression forces. 
					
					 Washington, however, is claiming that its military drills assume the "defensive nature" to cope with someone's "threat" and "provocation", the commentary noted, and went on:
					
					 It is a scenario of the U.S. to stigmatize the DPRK as the "threatening forces" in a bid to justify its moves for invading the DPRK and carry out its sinister goal.
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle are a test nuclear war and a preliminary war to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK from A to Z.
					
					 The U.S. is taking issue with the DPRK groundlessly, talking about "threat" and "provocation". This is nothing but a brazen-faced and base ploy to cover up its true colors as a wrecker of peace, provocateur and aggressor and lay the blame for it at the door of the DPRK.
					
					 It is a daydream for the U.S. to try to provoke the DPRK by force. No force can settle any issue but it will only drive the situation into a catastrophe.
					
					 If the U.S. ignites a nuclear war, the DPRK will have no choice but to take a thousand-fold strong self-defensive measure as it regards the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation as its life.
					
					 The U.S. would be advised to clearly understand the will of the army and people of the DPRK and make a right option, though belatedly.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improved North-South Ties
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Improved North-South Ties
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Only when the north-south relations are improved to be turned into the ones of deep trust and unity, can the basic conditions for national reunification be provided and independent reunification, peace and prosperity be achieved by the concerted efforts of all Koreans, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Improving the north-south relations is the essential task for ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula and realizing the independent reunification of the country and the prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 The nearly 70 year-long history of the Korean nation's division teaches a bitter lesson that the escalated confrontation between the north and the south of Korea brings nothing but the lasting partition and war disasters.
					
					 The north-south relations can never remain the ties of confrontation.
					
					 Although differing ideologies and systems exist in the north and the south, they are not the reason of the distrust and confrontation.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations should become the ties between the homogeneous compatriots and the ones of By Our Nation Itself, whereby they advance toward peace and reunification hand in hand.
					
					 Converting the present inter-Korean ties plagued by distrust and confrontation into ones of trust and reconciliation is the best way for averting a war on the Korean Peninsula and achieving independent reunification, peace and prosperity by the concerted efforts of the nation.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities give up the narrow-minded conception of confrontation and make a bold decision to join hands with compatriots in the north, there are no insurmountable difficulties in mending the inter-Korean relations. This was evidenced by the June 15 era of reunification.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns Japan of Its Moves for Militarization
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns Japan of Its Moves for Militarization
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Abe, who comes under fire by the international community for his visit to Yasukuni Shrine, said at his New Year news conference that now is the time for Japan to start a battle to restore "strong Japan." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What Abe uttered reveals his scenario to restore the imperialist state which invaded many Asian countries at the beginning of the 20th century, crying out for becoming the "leader" of Asia.
					
					 This is a blatant challenge and mockery of not only the Korean people but also other peace-loving people of the world.
					
					 Moves are being pressed forward in Japan in real earnest to convert itself into a militarist and war state. 
					
					 Japan has rushed headlong into the moves for militarization. This is evidenced by the facts that it worked out the "defence programme guidelines," "Midterm Defence Capability Adjustment Plan" and a "strategy for state security", the first of its kind in its history late last year. At the outset of this year, it set up the "National Security Council" and the "National Security Agency" which plays the role of secretariat under it.
					
					 The successive regimes of Japan worked hard without exception to remove legal and institutional hurdles lying in the way of converting itself into a military giant and launching overseas aggression. But no regime has gone so mad with militarist hysteria like the Abe regime.   It is the preoccupation of the Japanese reactionaries to make all Japanese diehard militarists by denying the history of aggression and thus bring back those days when the Japanese imperialists could occupy vast regions of Asia in the last century, under the signboard of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere". This is, however, nothing but a daydream.
					
					 Japan is going along the road of ruin.

articles.title: Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Japan
articles.content:
Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- A seminar took place in Okinawa on January 12 on the subject "How to uphold independence this year - seminar on the Juche idea to carve out future." 
					 Present at the seminar were figures of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Japanese National Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea, Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the International Institute of the Juche Idea, other followers of the Juche idea from across Japan and people of various circles in Okinawa.
					
					 Seiichi Sakugawa, president of the Japanese National Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea who is representative of the Okinawa Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, referred to the situation in Okinawa where accidents are occurring ceaselessly and peaceful life is exposed to threats due to the U.S. military base. He accused the Japanese government of kowtowing to the U.S. but paying no heed to voice of the residents in Okinawa demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. military base.
					
					 It is very important to follow the Juche idea in deciding the Okinawa issue by the residents in the prefecture responsible for the issue, he noted.
					
					 Kenichi Taira, deputy representative of the Okinawa Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, blamed the government for kowtowing to the U.S., bereft of independence as a sovereign state.
					
					 Kinhide Mushakoji, advisor to the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that Japan is now divided over the policy of the Japanese government rushing headlong into militarism and the demands of the people for independence and peace. He called upon the independent forces to pool their efforts and build new Asia in solidarity with Asian peoples.
					
					 Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, denounced the present government for having consistently pursued the policy of war.
					
					 In order to reject the "theory of threat from the DPRK" and promote dialogue, it is important to conduct a positive movement for the Japan-DPRK friendship, he added.

articles.title: Ceremony of Releasing "Works of Kim Jong Un" Held in Japan
articles.content:
Ceremony of Releasing "Works of Kim Jong Un" Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of releasing "Works of Kim Jong Un" took place in Okinawa, Japan on Jan. 12.
					 Present there were personages of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Japanese National Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea, Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the International Institute of the Juche Idea and figures in Okinawa and Juche idea followers.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Seiichi Sakugawa, president of the National Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea who doubles as representative of the Okinawa Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, and Fujio Hanawa, co-representative of the Kanto Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, expressed their will to more deeply study and widely disseminate the Juche idea which is propellant to the human cause of independence.
					
					 Kenichi Taira, deputy representative of the Okinawa Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that the Japanese government's kowtowing to the U.S. is causing a big problem, adding that Okinawa's struggle for independence should be led to the one for achieving independence throughout Japan.
					
					 Kinhide Mushakoji, advisor to the Society for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, referred to the publication of "Works of Kim Jong Un", calling for heightening vigilance against imperialism and "globalization."
					
					 Yukie Ikebe, co-representative of the Kansai Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, noted that the Juche idea clarifies the essential characteristics of human being, expressing his will to intensify the study and dissemination of the Juche idea so that Japan would take the road of independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Mexican Personage
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Mexican Personage
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, issued a statement on Jan. 9 in support of the New Year Address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The president said: 
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address reviewed the shining successes achieved by the Korean people in building a thriving socialist nation and defending socialism under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) last year.
					
					 He stressed the year 2014 will be a year of grandiose struggle, a year of sea changes, in which the Korean people usher in a golden age of Songun Korea by raising a fierce wind of making a fresh leap forward on all fronts of building a thriving socialist country.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that the WPK and the Korean people would bring about a great victory and changes in the drive to build a thriving socialist nation under the uplifted banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the great guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 We extend full support and solidarity to the WPK and the Korean people in their just struggle to reunify the country.
					
					 We express sympathy with the independent foreign policy of the DPRK working hard for global peace and security and prosperity common to humankind in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Demand Withdrawal of US Troops from S. Korea
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Demand Withdrawal of US Troops from S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Jan. 13 denouncing the U.S. imperialists for their arms build-up in south Korea.
					 The U.S. imperialists are mulling beefing up their air force in south Korea, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 This is another reckless provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 This goes to clearly prove that Washington is preparing a new war against the DPRK and watching for a chance of aggression.
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggression forces are seeking to occupy south Korea forever.
					
					 All their criminal moves for a war of aggression are driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula and other parts in Northeast Asia again to the brink of a war.
					
					 The statement demanded the U.S. stop at once its air force build-up in south Korea and withdraw its aggression forces from it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Russia
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on January 9.
					 The work, published on April 27, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in land management and indicates the general orientation and tasks for giving a face-lifting to the appearance of the land as befitting a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige entrenamiento nocturno de paracaidistas de EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige entrenamiento nocturno de paracaidistas de EPC
Pyongyang, 20 de enero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio el entrenamiento nocturno de las subunidades de  paracaidistas del EPC.
					Tras recibir el parte de capitan de mando  sobre  el plan de entrenamiento, el Mariscal dio la orden de inicio.
					
					Volaron sobre el cielo del campo de entrenamiento los aviones de transporte y seguidamente los paracaidistas se lanzaron hacia la tierra.
					
					Ellos aterrizaron exactamente en las destinaciones determinadas cumpliendo plenamente los metodos de combate y movimientos adiestrados en los dias ordinarios y ocuparon de un tiron los "blancos enemigos".
					
					Los valientes combatientes, quienes se ejercitaron dia y noche, cumplieron con exito la orden del entrenamiento del Comandante Supremo.
					
					El entrenamiento resulto muy bien, dijo el Mariscal y evaluo que los combatientes y pilotos ejecutaron magnificamente las misiones dificiles aun en la desfavorable condicion nocturna.
					
					Se reunio con los combatientes quienes ejecutaron con exito entrenamiento de aterrizaje al punto que demanda la intrepidez y la elevada habilidad y les estimulo.
					
					El EPC debe dar acicate a la perfeccion de los preparativos de combate, demanda principal en la intensificacion del poderio militar, senalo y dio valiosas instrucciones para levantar la oleada de entrenamiento del monte Paektu.
					
					Destaco que la confrontacion con los enemigos se realiza en las condiciones mas dificiles y anadio que con la elevada decision ideologica los uniformados deben hacer el entrenamiento considerandolo como batalla real para cumplir con satisfaccion las tareas combativas asumidas ante ellos aun en medio de cualquier tiempo y condiciones.
					
					Le acompanaron Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Pyon In Son, Kim Kyok Sik, Kim Su Gil, Ri Pyong Chol, Pak Jong Chon y Hwang Pyong So.

articles.title: Kenneth Bae concede rueda de prensa
articles.content:
Kenneth Bae concede rueda de prensa
Pyongyang, 20 de enero (ACNC) -- El criminal norteamericano Kenneth Bae concedio el dia 20 una conferencia de prensa en el Hospital de Amistad de Pyongyang.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion los reporteros nacionales y extranjeros.
					
					Solicite esta entrevista para aclarar algunos hechos, dijo Bae y prosiguio:
					
					Durante 15 meses pasados desde que vine aqui, tuve la entrevista con los miembros de la Embajada de Suecia en Corea e intercambie llamadas telefonicas y cartas con mis familiares.
					
					Por conducto de ellos, informe al gobierno norteamericano y a mis familiares los crimenes que he cometido y las medidas humanitarias tomadas por el gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Pero, en estos dias, circulan las publicaciones que incluyen datos tergiversados sobre mi situacion y la demagogia al gobierno de la RPDC.
					
					Por ejemplo, en la conferencia de prensa sobre la liberacion del ciudadano norteamericano Newman retenido en diciembre del ano pasado, el vicepresidente estadounidense dijo que yo estoy retenido en Corea sin ninguna razon.
					
					Tengo entendido que hasta mi hermana menor se entrevisto con los periodistas diciendo como si yo fuera inocente. Creo que esas cosas causaron la indignacion del gobierno de la RPDC.
					
					Ademas, complicaron mucho mi situacion.
					
					Estoy hospitalizado durante 5 meses pasados. Parece que pronto volveran a mandarme al reformatorio. Ademas, pienso que sera mas dificil la solucion del problema de mi indulto.
					
					Otro ejemplo, en las desinformaciones hay expresiones como la RPDC es "pais violador de DDHH" y con mal indice de DDHH y que fui sometido hasta ahora a tratamientos injustos.
					
					Quiero dejar en claro aqui que durante 15 meses pasados, no hubo ningun acto de violacion de mis DDHH ni vejaciones.
					
					Hasta ahora, el gobierno de la RPDC tomo todas las medidas humanitarias posibles para mi.
					
					Por ejemplo, permitio el contacto con la embajada sueca, el intercambio de cartas y llamadas telefonicas con mis familiares y la visita de mi madre.
					
					Cuando se torno grave mi enfermedad, me permitio recibir el tratamiento medico en el hospital.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad, exhorto al gobierno norteamericano, los medios de prensa y mis familiares a no empeorar mas mi situacion con la demagogia anti-RPDC y los datos no apegados a la realidad.
					
					Deseo ser indultado cuanto antes por el gobierno de la RPDC y regresar a mi familia.
					
					Encomiendo al gobierno estadounidense, los medios de prensa y mis familiares que presten mas atencion a mi caso y redoblen los esfuerzos por mi regreso.
					
					Seguidamente, Bae respondio a las preguntas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena sospechoso movimiento militar de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena sospechoso movimiento militar de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 20 de enero (ACNC) -- A finales del ano pasado, Estados Unidos ubico en el suelo surcoreano el 23o batallon anti-quimico y el 4o batallon de reconocimiento de helicopteros de ataque del 6o regimiento de caballeria.
					Decidio emplazar adicionalmente cerca de la Linea de Demarcacion Militar la unidad de infanteria motorizada compuesta por 40 tanques de ultimo modelo e igual numero de carros blindados.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, anuncio que libraria desde finales de febrero hasta finales de abril los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle".
					
					En un comentario individual divulgado la vispera, el diario Rodong Sinmun condeno que ese movimiento militar persigue el objetivo de desatar a toda costa la segunda guerra coreana, y prosiguio:
					
					Sin embargo, el imperio justifica sus acciones militares mintiendo que ellas tienen el "caracter defensivo" frente a la supuesta "amenaza" y la "provocacion" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					"Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" no son maniobras defensivas sino el experimento de guerra nuclear y ataque preventivo contra la RPDC.
					
					Al tildar a la RPDC de "amenazadora" y "provocadora", el imperio trata de disimular su naturaleza de destructor de paz, provocador y agresor e imputar la responsabilidad a la primera.
					
					Con el uso de la fuerza no se puede resolver nada, por el contrario, llevara la situacion a la catastrofe.
					
					Si EE.UU. provoca finalmente la guerra nuclear prefiriendo el garrote, la RPDC, que considera como su vida la soberania y la dignidad nacional, se vera obligada a tomar las medidas autodefensivas mil veces mas fuertes.
					
					EE.UU. debe tomar una opcion correcta al comprender bien la voluntad del ejercito y pueblo coreanos.

articles.title: Militarizacion llevara a Japon al arruinamiento, advierte Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Militarizacion llevara a Japon al arruinamiento, advierte Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 20 de enero (ACNC) -- El premier japones Abe es criticado ahora por la sociedad internacional por haber visitado al santuario Yasukuni donde se conservan las tablas mortuorias de los criminales de guerra de primera categoria.
					Para colmo, el dijo en su entrevista del Ano Nuevo que desde ahora comienza la lucha por rescatar a "Japon poderoso". 
					
					Su palabra significa rehabilitar a Japon imperialista que en la primera mitad del siglo 20, agredio a muchos paises para hacerse "senor" de Asia.
					
					Revela asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este lunes destacando que ese proyecto resulta desafio frontal y burla al pueblo coreano y los demas pacifistas de Asia y el mundo entero. 
					
					Ahora se impulsan en etapa crucial en Japon los preparativos para convertir el pais en Estado militarista y guerrerista. 
					
					A finales del ano pasado, Japon trazo el programa de defensa, el plan de arreglo de fuerzas defensivas de tiempo intermedio y la primera estrategia de seguridad nacional.
					
					Al principio de este ano, instalo el "consejo de seguridad nacional" y la "agencia de seguridad nacional" que funciona como secretariado del primero. 
					
					Hasta la fecha, Japon vino eliminando los aparatos legales e institucionales que obstaculizaban la conversion del pais en potencia militar y la agresion a ultramar. Tales pasos de militarizacion se tornaron mas abiertos y desesperados que nunca en el poder de Abe. 
					
					Pero, no se realizara nunca el intento de los reaccionarios japoneses de convertir a todos los habitantes en los militaristas y reproducir aquel tiempo en que los imperialistas nipones senoreaban en vastas zonas de Asia abogando por establecer la "esfera de coprosperidad de gran Asia oriental". 
					
					Ahora Japon esta en la via de arruinamiento.
